items.title: Can the U.K. Still Save Its Oil and Gas Industry?
items.summary: When the UK’s government slapped a 25% windfall tax on oil and gas producers in 2022, the industry warned this could be the death knell for local oil and gas production. Four years later, the UK’s oil and gas industry is being described as “irrelevan

items.title: ADNOC’s LNG Expansion Signals a New Phase of Energy Leverage
items.summary: Abu Dhabi’s national oil company, ADNOC, keeps making headlines again, not only when looking at upstream but also in its LNG strategic operations. At present, the oil and gas giant’s quiet acceleration in LNG shipping is often treated as merely a cap

items.title: Venezuela’s Oil Revival Could Reward the Company That Never Left
items.summary: Canada-based Ensign Energy Services has been working in Venezuela for 25 years and has never left the country, where rig counts have plummeted, and the political and regulatory landscape has been a minefield to navigate. “We’re the only Canadian comp
